name: Gender and the City
description: In this course students will be introduced to approaches in social geography that examine the links between gender and urban environments. Specific topics and issues to be covered include, for example, poverty, work, sex trade, human trafficking and safety. Topics will be explored across multiple scales including bodies, home, neighbourhood and community.ÿThis course fulfills 1 field day. [24L, 12T] This course is crosslisted with Women's/Gender Studies
